title: What is the meaning and background of the phrase "Cosi non basta" in the context of Western tradition and paganism?
first_phrase: In the final 200 tokens of this text, the author addresses the idea of detachment and self-control in order to achieve a deeper understanding of oneself and make better choices. The author mentions the importance of letting chance take over decision-making, using tools to verify reality from illusion, and taking control of one's desires. He advocates for a disciplined approach to personal growth and self-awareness. Previously in the text, the author critiqued the devaluation of pagan traditions and beliefs by Western societies, while discussing the works of a French Masonic writer J.M. Ragon, who theorized on the nature of Roman and Druidic initiation rituals.
content: Tentala, perciò, speri mentala in tutti i versi, su tutte le vie trascinala giù giù acciocché la reazione infine si palesi; e nella reazione si palesi il vincolo; e dal vincolo tu possa risalire a chi la tiene vincolata, a questo altro strapparla e tu stesso sosti tuirti, a fine che essa sia tua anima, incondizionatamen te: senza reazione e senza riserva che le sia più possibile. Non puoi permetterti purezza, gioia, semplicità, pri ma di allora, quale « Figlio di Ermete ». last_phrase: In conclusion, the text emphasizes the importance of pursuing mental experimentation and breaking free from conditioning to attain pure, unreserved spiritual freedom. It also highlights criticisms of pagan tradition by certain French authors. While controversial, these views encourage us to question assumptions and forge our own paths towards spiritual awakening.
